Lighter completes audits and open-sources ZK verification code

@Lighter_xyz, a zero knowledge rollup DEX on Ethereum for perpetual and spot trading, announced the completion of third party audits on its ZK circuits and has open sourced its verification code. This allows anyone to independently verify orders, cancellations, and liquidations with cryptographic proofs, no intermediaries required.

The move pushes Lighter‚Äôs core pitch: zero fees, millisecond latency, and fully verifiable execution. By making the verification layer public, Lighter aims to reduce blind trust in DeFi trading venues and address recurring issues around opaque matching, liquidations, and exchange failures.

The update has been well received across crypto, reinforcing a broader shift toward provable DeFi infrastructure rather than trust-based systems.
